citeinfo.origin: U.S. Department of Commerce, Bureau of the Census
Massachusetts Institute for Social and Economic Research, University of Massachusetts
Massachusetts Office of Geographic and Environmental Information (MassGIS)
citeinfo.title: Massachusetts Media Outlets

descript.abstract: This datalayer will display the name, address, media type (newspaper, radio, magazine, journal, supplement, or guide), circulation, and wattage for media establishments throughout the state. The data were originally derived from, "Gale's Directory of Advertising and Media Sources." This layer was derived from the Massachusetts Electronic Atlas database published by the Harvard Map Collection in 2001. The Massachusetts Electronic Atlas (MEA) was a collaborative project to provides access, via the Internet, to data about the Commonwealth, its thirteen regional planning agency districts and 351 cities and towns. This dataset is now only available via The Harvard Geospatial Library.
descript.purpose: This layer is intended for researchers, students, and policy makers for reference and mapping purposes, and may be used for basic applications such as viewing, querying, and map output production. This layer will provide a basemap for layers related to socio-political anaylsis, statistical enumeration and analysis, or to support graphical overlays and analysis with other spatial data. More advanced user applications may focus on demographics, urban and rural land use planning, socio-economic analysis and related areas including defining boundaries, managing assets and facilities, integrating attribute databases with geographic features, spatial analysis, and presentation output.

place.placekt: United States Geological Survey (USGS) Geographic Names Information System (GNIS)

idinfo.useconst: For educational, non-commercial use only. Although this data set has been developed by the Harvard Map Collection and its partners, no warranty expressed or implied is made by the producers as to the accuracy of the data and related materials. The act of distribution shall not constitute any such warranty, and no responsibility is assumed by the producers in the use of this data, or related materials.

cntinfo.hours: Monday through Friday 9:00 A.M. to 4:00 P.M. EST-USA

idinfo.datacred: The Massachusetts Electronic Atlas dataset was a joint project of Douglas Carnahan, formerly of the Metropolitan Area Planning Council (MAPC), Richard Gelpke of the Earth and Geographic Sciences Department of the University of Massachusetts at Boston, and David Cobb, Bonnie Burns, Martin von Wyss, and Arlene Olivero of the Harvard Map Collection. Valuable technical assistance and support has been provided by Environmental Systems Research Institute (ESRI), Peter Girard of ESRI, and the Harvard College Library.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.0 (Build 2195) Service Pack 4; ESRI ArcCatalog 8.3.0.800

attracc.attraccr: Topological Properties The attribute accuracy of these files is as precise as the source used during the creation or update of the Massachusetts Electronic Atlas (MEA) database. No specific field tests for attribute accuracy have been conducted on the files.

dataqual.complete: Data completeness of the Massachusetts Electronic Atlas (MEA) files reflects the contents of the database at the time the files were created. Data for a given category contain attribute codes that reflect the information portrayed on the original source.

horizpa.horizpar: The Massachusetts Electronic Atlas' (MEA) mission to profile the Commonwealth's people and institutions did not require the highest level of positional accuracy. Coordinates in these files are in decimal degrees and have six implied decimal places. The six-decimal place precision is useful when producing maps as it allows you to place features that are next to each other on the ground in the correct position, relative to each other, on the map without overlap.

citeinfo.title: Gale's Directory of Advertising and Media Sources

srcinfo.srccontr: Massachusetts media outlet characteristics were derived from this published source.
Town boundaries derived from MassGIS datasets

procstep.procdesc: Tabular data compiled and edited by Richard Gelpe of UMass-Boston; Boundary data derived from MassGIS database. Feature attribute file was joined to the geography using ArcView GIS v 3.2.

cntinfo.hours: Monday through Friday 9:00 A.M. to 4:00 P.M. EST-USA

procstep.procdesc: The files were processed to shapefile format using the TGR2SHP.exe software program from GIS Tools (version 4.0). The shape file was then imported to an ArcSDE Layer.

cntinfo.hours: Monday through Friday 9:00 A.M. to 4:00 P.M. EST-USA

attrvai.attrvae: The initial "0" was deleted during processing, rendering this number the last 4 digits of the primary zip code and, in some cases, this truncated number does not match the actual postal zip code for the location
